japanese: ５年後――
translation: Five years later%p-2;――

japanese: いらっしゃ――
translation: Welcome%p-2;――

japanese: って、あんたたちか。
translation: Oh, it's you guys.

japanese: 一花、おかえりー！
translation: Ichika, welcome back!

japanese: 久しぶり。
translation: It's been a while.

japanese:
久しぶり、３人とも。
元気そうだね。
translation:
Long time no see, you three.
It's good to see you looking well.

japanese: それに、お店も大繁盛で大忙しのようで。
translation: And I see the shop is obviously bursting at the seams with customers.

japanese: あらあら、アメリカかぶれはジョークがお上手ねぇ。
translation: Yeah, yeah, and here I thought you were better at those sarcastic American-style jokes.

japanese:
いや、だってさ、てっきり３人のうちの誰かが
迎えに来てくれると思ってたのに――
translation:
Well, come on, I thought one of you
would at least come pick me up%p-2;――

japanese:
まさか花嫁本人がお出迎えなんて。
ビックリしたどころじゃないよ。
translation:
I never expected the bride herself to come meet me.
I was pretty surprised.

japanese:
あはは……。
五月が自分で行くって言って聞かなくてさ。
translation:
Ahaha...
I told Itsuki not to go by herself,
but she didn't listen.

japanese:
当たり前だよ。
私のために、わざわざアメリカから
帰ってきてくれたんだから。
translation:
Well, of course.
She came all the way back from America just for me.

japanese:
相変わらず五月ちゃんは真面目というか、
律儀というか。
translation:
Itsuki-chan is still as serious or rather,
conscientious as ever.

japanese:
やっと昔のお硬い口調が抜けたのに、
中身は変わってないのよね。
translation:
She finally got rid of her stiff way of talking,
but her personality hasn't changed.

japanese: でも、先生は真面目なほうがいいんじゃない？
translation: But isn't it better for a teacher to be serious?

japanese: 真面目すぎるのもよくないかも。
translation: Being too serious might not be good either.

japanese:
だからって甘すぎるのもダメでしょ？
その辺、さじ加減が難しそう。
translation:
Well, being too sweet is also bad, right?
It seems difficult to strike a balance.

japanese: どう？　ちゃんと先生、やれてる？
translation: So? Are you doing well as a teacher?

japanese:
心配しなくてもちゃんとやれてるし、
いま楽しくて仕方ないんだ。
translation:
Don't worry, I'm doing well,
and I'm having a lot of fun now.

japanese: 楽しいって？
translation: Fun?

japanese:
んー、例えば、どんな授業をするか考えるのとか。
まだまだ試行錯誤中ではあるんだけど。
translation:
Hmm, for example,
thinking about what kind of lessons to teach.
Although, I'm still experimenting with it.

japanese:
少しずつやり方を変えてみて、
生徒の反応がよくなると嬉しいんだ。
translation:
I'm happy when I gradually change the way I teach
and get better reactions from the students.

japanese:
それにね、教え子もみんないい子なんだ。
この前もサプライズで結婚のお祝いを
してくれたんだよ。
translation:
Besides, all my students are good kids.
The other day, they surprised me
with a wedding celebration.

japanese: そっか、順調そうでよかった。
translation: I see, it seems to be going well.

japanese:
大変なことも多いけどね。
それも含めて、すごく充実してる。
translation:
There are many difficult things too.
But overall, it's very fulfilling.

japanese:
五月の授業、受けてみたいなー。
ここでやってみるとかどう？
translation:
I'd like to take your class, Itsuki.
How about doing it here?

japanese: ダメよ、ここは塾じゃないんだから。
translation: No! This isn't a cram school.

japanese: せっかく増えた常連さんが驚いちゃう。
translation:
The regulars who just started coming here
would be surprised.

japanese: お、常連さんもできたんだ。
translation: Oh, you have regulars now too.

japanese: うん、一応、軌道に乗ってきてる。
translation: Yes. We're on the right track for now.

japanese:
ここを貸してくれたお父さんのためにも、
この調子で頑張っていかないと。
translation:
We have to do our best for our father-in-law,
who lent us this place too.

japanese: うん、お互いに頑張ろう。
translation: Yes, let's both do our best.

japanese:
あんた、それだけ仕事に熱心となると、
今度はフー君との新生活のほうが心配なんだけど。
translation:
You being so dedicated to work, Itsuki,
now I'm worried about your new life with Fu-kun.

japanese: どうして？
translation: Why is that?

japanese: 教え子にばかり構ってたら、拗ねちゃうんじゃない？
translation:
If you only pay attention to your students,
he might get sulky, right?

japanese: え？
translation: Huh?

japanese: フータロー、あれで意外と寂しがり屋だし。
translation:
Futaro gets surprisingly lonely,
despite looking the way he does.

japanese: 俺と生徒、どっちが大事なんだ！
translation: He might say something like,

japanese: なんて言い出しちゃったりして。
translation:
'Which one is more important to you?
Me or your students?!'

japanese: さすがに、そんなことは言わないと思うけど。
translation: I don't think he would say something like that.

japanese: わかんないよ～？
translation: You never knooow?

japanese:
じゃあ、もしそうなっちゃったら
ちゃんと家庭内でフォローするよ。
translation:
Well, if that happens,
I'll make sure to support him at home.

japanese: ほほう？
translation: Oh-ho?

japanese: ふーん。
translation: Mmmm.

japanese: え？　なにその反応は。
translation: Huh? Why that reaction?

japanese: 家庭内でフォローだって。
translation: Support him at home, you said.

japanese: そっかー。
translation: I see.

japanese: べ、別に変な意味で言ったわけじゃないよ？
translation:
I-it's not like I said it
with any weird intentions, you know?

japanese: じゃあ、どうやってフォローするつもり？
translation: Then, how do you plan to support him?

japanese:
も、もうっ！
それより、そろそろ会場に行かないと！
translation: A-anyway! We should go to the venue soon!

japanese:
そうだね、準備があるし。
私の担当メイクさんも来てくれるって。
translation:
That's right, we have preparations to make.
Also, my makeup artist is coming too.

japanese: 本当にやるの？
translation: Are you really going to do it?

japanese:
当然よ。
五月だって乗り気だし、
フー君には確かめておきたいもの。
translation:
Of course. Itsuki's pretty excited herself.
We'll have to have Fu-kun confirm it for us.

japanese:
で、その前に。
あれも済ませておきましょ。
translation: But, before that, let's take care of this first.

japanese: 一花。
translation: Ichika.

japanese: つけてきたよ。
translation: I wore it here.

japanese:
私が預かってたほうは、
結局しまったままだったわ。
translation:
The one I kept
ended up staying in storage.

japanese: これが私たちからの結婚祝い。
translation: This is our wedding gift to you, Itsuki.

japanese: お母さんの、形見のピアス。
translation: It's Mom's heirloom earrings.

japanese: せーの――
translation: One, two, three%p-2;――

japanese: 五月、結婚おめでとう！
translation: Itsuki, congratulations on getting married!

japanese:
ありがとう。
大切にするから。
translation:
Thank you.
I'll cherish them.

japanese: いや、大切にするよりもいまここでつけなさいよ。
translation: No, you should put them on right now.

japanese: え。
translation: Huh?

japanese: そうだよ、今日の式でもつけなくちゃ！
translation: Yeah, you have to wear them for today's ceremony!

japanese: そ、そうだよね、そうなるよね。
translation: R-right, that's true, it's going to happen.

japanese:
ピアスホール、開けてあげる。
こっちに来て。
translation: I'll pierce your ears. Come over here.

japanese: い、いや、それなんだけど……。
translation: Um, well, about that...

japanese:
実は私、ピアスホール開けていいのか、
まだ悩んでるんだよね。
translation:
Actually, I'm still thinking if it's okay
to get my ears pierced.

japanese:
ほら、私は先生だから、教え子たちの
模範的な大人でいなくちゃいけないし――
translation:
You see, I'm a teacher, so I have to
be a good role model for my students%p-2;――

japanese: そんなこと言っちゃって、本当は怖い？
translation: Saying that kind of thing, you're just scared, right?

japanese: う……そんなことは……。
translation: Ooh... That's...

japanese: 図星だ。
translation: Bulls-eye.

japanese: うう……。
translation: Ooohh...

japanese:
ていうか、同僚に
ピアス開けてる人くらいいるでしょ？
translation:
Besides, there are a few colleagues of yours
who have their ears pierced, right?

japanese: ……何人か。
translation: A few.

japanese: だったら問題ないよね。
translation: Then it's not a problem, right?

japanese: だ、だけどぉ……。
translation: B-but...

japanese: 大丈夫、うんと優しくしてあげる。
translation: It's okay, I'll be gentle with you.

japanese: そうそう、優しく支えててあげるから。
translation: Yes, that's right, I'll support you as well.

japanese:
わっ！？
よ、四葉、離して！
translation:
WAA?!
Yotsuba, let go of me!

japanese: 痛いのは一瞬だけだから。
translation: The pain only lasts for a moment.

japanese: ほら、行くわよ～？
translation: Okay, here we gooo!

japanese: ひぇぇぇぇっ！？
translation: HYEEEEEEE?!
